info.title: edgeConfigurator API
info.description: The edgeConfigurator allows remote configuration of the edgeConnector product family.

post.description: Logging in the user based on credentials.
Refresh the access token.

get.description: Returns a list with all matched users.

post.description: Creates a new user.

get.description: Return a specific user.

put.description: Update a specific user.

delete.description: Deletes a specific user.

get.description: Retrieve the configuration of edgeConfigurator on-premise or edgeConfigurator cloud depends from where the call was made.

patch.description: Update the configuration of the edgeConfigurator on-premise or edgeConfigurator cloud depends from where the call was made.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all the edgeConnectors.

post.description: Add a new edgeConnector instance.

get.description: Retrieve an edgeConnector based on its id.

put.description: Update a specific edgeConnector based on its id.

patch.description: Update a specific edgeConnector based on its id.

delete.description: Deletes a specific edgeConnector based on its id.

get.description: Retrieve a list with all the edgeConfigurators on-premise.

post.description: Add a new edgeConfigurator on-premise instance.

get.description: Retrieve the specific edgeConfigurator on-premise based on its id.

put.description: Update a specific edgeConfigurator on-premise based on its id.

patch.description: Update a specific edgeConfigurator on-premise based on its id.

delete.description: Deletes a specific edgeConfigurator on-premise based on its id.

post.description: Synchronize the configured connectors between the cloud and on premise edgeConfigurator.

get.description: Retrieve the specific configuration of edgeConfigurator on-premise based on its id.

patch.description: Update a specific configuration of edgeConfigurator on-premise based on its id.

get.description: This operation provides a summary data of all users.

post.description: Add a new user to the system.

get.description: Returns detailed information on the specified user.

post.description: Modifies details of the specified user.

delete.description: Delete the user.

get.description: Returns HTTP ok if the passed user credentials have been correct.
Returns the authentication token which will be used to pass the logged on user information at each call.

delete.description: Delete the current authentication token for the user. This can be used as logout command if the configuration session is closed.

get.description: Returns the group names the specified user name is part of.

post.description: Modifies the assignement of the specified user to the groups identified by value of the key name.

get.description: Returns the context in which the the specified user name is used.
Get data of all groups.

put.description: Create a new group - not needed for Raven Rev1.
Create a new group. The name of the new group shall be part of the URI (see group name).

delete.description: Delete the group.

get.description: Get data of all users of the group.

put.description: Add a user to the group.

delete.description: Delete a user from the group.

post.description: Creates a temporary PKI for the user certificates - associated to the specified user, or for a user that will be created if the given user is null. The content is copied from the specified user.

delete.description: Deletes the specified temporary PKI (so all changes on it are cancelled).

post.description: Set the certificate additional data for the next certificate or PFX upload.

get.description: Returns details of all certificates (associated to the current user).

put.description: Uploads a certificate (DER or PEM format) or a PFX containing a certificate and the corresponding private key.

get.description: Returns details of the selected user certificate.

delete.description: Deletes the certificate.

get.description: Returns the selected certificate, in DER format.
Returns the selected certificate, in PEM format.
Returns the selected certificate and its corresponding private key, in PFX format.

post.description: Creates a new certificate with private key for the specified user.
Sets the default certificate to be used for outgoing UA connections.

get.description: Get the system status.

post.description: Start the system.
Stop the system.
Restart the system (stop and then start again).

get.description: Retrieves the network interfaces IP information. Later used to compute addresable endpoint URLs.
Get the existent .log files (including filename and last modified time) stored into the currently configured trace files location.
Retrieves the content of the specified file_name.log if found in the currently configured trace files location.
Get general audit log settings.

post.description: Change general audit log settings.

get.description: Get the existent .log files (including filename and last modified time) stored into the currently configured audit files location.
Retrieves the content of the specified file_name.log if found in the currently configured audit files location.
Get information about the installed licenses (features).
Retrieve the configured floating license servers (up to 3).

post.description: Configured floating license servers (up to 3).

get.description: Get the number of preallocated datapoint licenses.

post.description: Set the number of preallocated datapaoint licenses.

get.description: Get the server complete configuration archived in a zip file.

put.description: Import a zip file containing the configuration. It's using the duplicate of configuration option, does not override the IP settings, the device name and the licenses.
Import a zip file containing the configuration. It's using the restore of configuration option.

post.description: Restores the configuration to the factory default. It keeps (does not overwrite) however, the IP settings and the licenses.

get.description: Gets a list with pre-defined configurations.

post.description: Restores the configuration to the named pre-defined one. Normally used for loading a demo configuration, from the product configuration. It keeps (does not overwrite) however, the IP settings and the licenses.

get.description: Gets the list of available internal (automatic) backups.
Gets the zip containing the specified backup.

delete.description: Deletes the specified internal backup.

post.description: Restores the configuration from the specified internal backup.

get.description: Gets the settings for automatic backups.

post.description: Sets the settings for automatic backups.
Triggers the generation of the support data file as a zip archive and saves it in a temporary location.

get.description: Get the previously generated zip file.
Retrieves the product software version.
Retrieves a set of application settings.

post.description: Set the application settings details.
Issues a forward hierarchical browse transaction using the specified session type name. Returns the NodeId, DisplayName and NodeClass of the resulting nodes.

get.description: Get the enabled state of the MQTT module.

post.description: Change the enabled state of the MQTT module.

get.description: Get the common settings for the MQTT module.
Get the configured connections.

put.description: Add a connection.

get.description: Get the connection with the specified name.

post.description: Modifies the connection with the specified name.

delete.description: Deletes the connection with the specified name.

get.description: Download the broker certificate.
Get the special placeholders.
Get the configured publish requests for MQTT module.
Get the configured publish requests for MQTT module.

put.description: Creates a new publish request with the specified settings and assigns it to the connection specified in the URL as <conn-name>.
Creates a new publish request with the specified settings and assigns it to the connection specified in the URL as <conn-name>.

post.description: Modifies the (existing) publish request specified in the URL as <request-name> and assigns it to the connection identified as <conn-name>.
Modifies the (existing) publish request specified in the URL as <request-name> and assigns it to the connection identified as <conn-name>.

get.description: Retrieves the the details of the named publish request.

delete.description: Deletes the publish request with the specified name <request-name>.

get.description: Retrieves the the details of the named publish request.

delete.description: Deletes the publish request with the specified name <request-name>.

post.description: Initiate the test on the connection availability for the connection define in the request.

get.description: Retrieve the connection availability for a specific connection identified by <connection name>.

delete.description: Cancels the in progress connection test identified by <conn-name>.

post.description: Creates a temporary PKI for manipulating certificates.

delete.description: Removes temporary PKI.

get.description: Get the default parameters for the Client App certificate.
Get the server own application certificate summary.

put.description: Import the server own application certificate.

get.description: Get own certificate details.
Get the server own application certificate.

post.description: Set the own certificate password.
Set a new servers own certificate.

get.description: Retrieve a list with the available certificates from the other endpoints.

post.description: Copies the own certificate from an existing endpoint as the own certificate.

get.description: Get the list of trusted application certificates summaries.

put.description: Import a trusted app certificate.

get.description: Get the given trusted certificate details.

delete.description: Delete the certificate.

get.description: Get the given trusted certificate details.
Get the given trusted certificate details.

delete.description: Delete the certificate.

post.description: Moves a certificate from rejected to trusted.

get.description: Get the discovery server information

post.description: Set the discovery server url.

put.description: Import the discovery server certificate.

get.description: Get the enabled state of the server.

post.description: Change the enabled state of the server.

get.description: Gets the specific settings for the Ip Filtering feature for the specified endpoint, including the list of the configured Ip ranges (if configured) subject to filtering.

post.description: Changes the settings for the Ip Filtering feature of the specified endpint.

get.description: Gets the default actions to be performed when a large number of failed authentication attempts are performed on an endpoint.
Get a summary of the configured endpoints list.
Get the details of the specified endpoint.

put.description: Add a new endpoint definition.

post.description: Change an existing endpoint.

delete.description: Delete endpoint specified by <endpoint>.

get.description: Get the list of the configured users for specified endpoint.
Get the details for the specified <endpoint>/<user> pair.

put.description: Add a new user to the current endpoint.

post.description: Change the parameters for the specified <endpoint>/<user> pair. Only the changed attribute has to be passed in the request content.

delete.description: Delete the specified user from the current endpoint.

get.description: Gets the actions to be performed when a large number of failed authentication attempts are performed on the specified endpoint, plus the state of those actions.

post.description: Changes the actions to be performed when a large number of failed authentication attempts are performed on the specified existing endpoint.

put.description: If the endpoint is temporarily or permanently disabled as a result of access protection restriction, this call shall reset the state of the access protection and the endpoints shall be re-enabled.

post.description: If the endpoint is temporarily or permanently disabled as a result of access protection restriction, this call shall reset the state of the access protection and the endpoints shall be re-enabled.

If one or more client certificates is temporarily or permanently disabled on the given endpoint as a result of access protection restriction, this call shall reset the state of the access protection for the certificates with specified thumbprints.

If one or more client IPs are temporarily or permanently disabled on the given endpoint as a result of access protection restriction, this call shall reset the state of the access protection for the specified IPs.

get.description: Retrieve all configured Siemens SINUMERIK 840D connections.

put.description: Creates a new Siemens SINUMERIK 840D connection and persists the information in the configuration file. If enabled it applies it immediately after a success confirmation.

get.description: Retrieves the Siemens SINUMERIC 840D connection identified by name <conn_name> .

post.description: Updates an existing Siemens SINUMERIK 840D connection with the new information. If changes are detected and if enabled it applies it immediately after a success confirmation.

delete.description: Deletes the Siemens SINUMERIC 840D connection identified by name <conn_name> .

put.description: Upload an AWL symbol file for the connection identified by name <conn_name>.
Upload an SDFI symbol file for the connection identified by name <conn_name>.

get.description: Retrieves default advanced settings values.
Retrieve all configured Siemens Siemens S7-32 connections.

put.description: Creates a new Siemens Siemens S7-32 connection and persists the information in the configuration file. If enabled it applies it immediately after a succeess confirmation.

get.description: Retrieve configured Siemens Siemens S7-32 connection identified by <conn_name>.

post.description: Updates an existing Siemens Siemens S7-32 connection with the new information. If changes are detected and if enabled it applies it immediately after a succeess confirmation.

delete.description: Deletes the Siemens S7-32 connection identified by name <conn_name> .

put.description: Upload an SDFI symbol file for the connection identified by name <conn_name>.

get.description: Retrieves default advanced settings values.
Retrieve all configured Siemens S7-72 connections.

put.description: Creates a new Siemens S7-72 connection and applies it immediately after a success confirmation.

get.description: Retrieve the Siemens S7-72 connection identified by name <conn_name> .

post.description: Updates an existing Siemens S7-72 connection with the new information and applies it immediately after a success confirmation.

delete.description: Deletes the Siemens S7-72 connection identified by name <conn_name> .

get.description: Retrieves default advanced settings values.
Retrieve all configured Modbus connections.

put.description: Creates a new Modbus connection and persists the information in the configuration file. If enabled it applies it immediately after a succeess confirmation.

get.description: Retrieve configured Modbus connection identified by <conn_name>.

post.description: Updates an existing Modbus connection with the new information. If changes are detected and if enabled it applies it immediately after a succeess confirmation.

delete.description: Deletes the Modbus connection identified by name <conn_name> .

put.description: Upload an TXT symbol file for the connection identified by name <conn_name>.

get.description: Retrieves default advanced settings values.
This operation provides the server identity.
Gets the core Subscriptions and Monitored Items options.

post.description: Sets the core Subscriptions and Monitored Items options.

get.description: Get xml files stored in <configuration base>\uacore\nodeset as a json list.

post.description: Creates the specified xml under folder <configuration base>\uacore\nodeset.

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: the name of the xml file

delete.description: Deletes the specified xml from folder <configuration base>\uacore\nodeset.

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: the name of the xml file

get.description: Get the previously generated NodeSet2 XML file.

post.description: Set generated NodeSet xml file.
Triggers the generation of the NodeSet2 XML file describing the address space of the server. Once generated the file is saved it in a temporary location.
Recreates the namespaces indexes/URIs mapping at the next transition into the running state of the system, keeping only the actual used ones.

Registers a UA namespace (no effect if the URI is already registered). Returns the allocated namespace index. !Note! It works only in running mode, and it is used only for making easier to test dataFEED SIS.

get.description: Get the list of configured sights, together with the allowed connection names for each.

put.description: Adds a sight definition, by specifying the name and the list of allowed connection names.

requestBody.description: the new customer data in JSON

get.description: Get the list of configured sights for which the type is type-external, together with the allowed connection names for each.
Get the list of configured sights for which the type is type-static, together with the allowed.
Get the definition of the specified <sightName> sight.

post.description: Change the specified sight definition by redefineing the list of allowed connection names.

delete.description: Deletes the specified sight definition.

get.description: Retrieves the list of configured sessions-to-sights map.

post.description: Adds/modify one entry in the list of sessions-to-sights map.

delete.description: Delete the existing mapping for the specified session type.

post.description: Get the information about the enable state of a filter for the specified sightName and sessionTypeName.
Open a new session for nodes filter manipulation, for the specified sight name and session type.

delete.description: Remove the existent filter for the specified nodes filter definition session and invalidates the session (no further editing is allowed for the <session-GUID>).

post.description: Save the current state of the filter definition for the specified nodes filter definition session and invalidates the session (no further editing is allowed for the <session-GUID>).
Discard the current in-progress filter definition for the specified filter definition session and invalidates the session (no further editing is allowed for the <session-GUID>).

Updated a nodes current service based filter mask definition (see details on the checked parameter below). The node will be recursively browsed on the corresponding source and the add/remove action will be applied to the node itself together with all the nodes in the sub-hierarchy discovered by hierarchical references.
Get the belongs-to-filter status for the specified nodes.

merging.description:
Merging parameter:
 * `true` - subscriptions and monitored items are never merged and the relation of subscriptions to monitored items is preserved
 * `false` - monitored items are merged if node ID, attribute, sampling interval, queue size, discard oldest, and the publishing interval of the subscription are the same.
